Thank you for your help!
There are two more organizational systems I would like to explain. In the homework folder, we use the red and blue clips to collect the completed worksheets. So you get an insight into what is being worked on at school. At the latest by the holidays, the sheets are then unstapled at home. You can create a binder or folder for this purpose. At school, we no longer need the sheets. If you notice that the folder is getting too full, you can empty the worksheets at any time. A reminder will follow at the latest before the holidays ğŸ˜Š
From time to time, you may see a â€œnoteâ€ in exercise books or on worksheets. These are things that have been forgotten and need to be added. Whenever possible, we will do this in the quarter of an hour before the end of the lesson. If there is not enough time, your child will receive extra work to do at home (e.g. at the weekend).
Another tip for correction: If you only see a check mark on a worksheet or in the workbook without my initials, then I have not corrected it, but only checked it for completeness. Occasionally, we have also worked on the page together in class and it does not need to be corrected.
